i1.name: Phenomenal Evil Power
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Veigar''' gains a [[stack]] of ''Phenomenal Evil'' whenever he hits an enemy {{tip|champion}} with an [[champion ability|ability]], and 5 stacks whenever he scores a champion {{tip|takedown}}.
'''Veigar''' gains {{sti|AP|{{as|1 ability power}}}} for every stack of ''Phenomenal Evil''.
i1.descriptionHtml:
Innate: Veigar gains a stack of Phenomenal Evil whenever he hits an enemy champion with an champion ability, and 5 stacks whenever he scores a champion takedown.
Veigar gains 1 ability power for every stack of Phenomenal Evil.
i1.notes:
* The two effects stack, granting 6 stacks for each enemy champion taken down by an ability, 7 with {{ai|Baleful Strike|Veigar}}.
* '''Veigar's''' abilities do not have to deal damage nor affect their targets to grant a stack.

q1.name: Baleful Strike
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} Killing an enemy with ''Baleful Strike'' grants 1 stack of {{ai|Phenomenal Evil Power|Veigar|Phenomenal Evil}}, doubled against large {{tip|minion|minions}} and {{tip|monster|monsters}}.
{{sbc|Active:}} '''Veigar''' unleashes a bolt of dark energy in the target direction, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to the first two enemies hit.
q1.descriptionHtml:
Passive: Killing an enemy with Baleful Strike grants 1 stack of Phenomenal Evil, doubled against large minions and monsters.
Active: Veigar unleashes a bolt of dark energy in the target direction, dealing magic damage to the first two enemies hit.
q1.notes:
* Killing two enemy champions with ''Baleful Strike'' grants {{tt|{{as|+14 AP}}|+12 from Phenomenal Evil Power and +2 from Baleful Strike}}.
* ''Baleful Strike'' will only grant stacks of {{ai|Phenomenal Evil Power|Veigar|Phenomenal Evil}} from its bolt, and not any additional effect that would kill other units from the same cast.
* ''Baleful Strike'' will cast from wherever '''Veigar''' is at the end of the cast time.

w1.name: Dark Matter
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Veigar''' calls a mass of dark matter to fall from the sky which lands after a {{rutngt|1.2}} {{tt|delay|from the start of the cast time}} to the target location, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to all enemies within the area.
''Dark Matter's'' {{sti|cooldown}} is reduced by a percentage, scaling with {{ai|Phenomenal Evil Power|Veigar|Phenomenal Evil}}.
w1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Veigar calls a mass of dark matter to fall from the sky which lands after a Unknown value: rutngt 1.2 delay to the target location, dealing magic damage to all enemies within the area.
Dark Matter's cooldown is reduced by a percentage, scaling with Phenomenal Evil.
w1.notes:
* The delay starts at the beginning of the cast time.
** If '''Veigar''' dies during the cast time, ''Dark Matter'' will still successfully fall from the sky.
* ''Dark Matter'' grants {{tip|sight}} of the area during the delay.

e1.name: Event Horizon
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Veigar''' forms a cage around the target location which materializes after a {{fd|0.5}} second delay and lasts for 3 seconds, {{tip|knockdown|knocking down}} and {{tip|stun|stunning}} all enemies that attempt to pass through its edges.
Units can only be affected by ''Event Horizon'' once every {{fd|4.5}} seconds.
e1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Veigar forms a cage around the target location which materializes after a 0.5 second delay and lasts for 3 seconds, knocking down and stunning all enemies that attempt to pass through its edges.
Units can only be affected by Event Horizon once every 4.5 seconds.
e1.notes:
* The stun and the knockdown are applied to units that are within a certain distance interval from the center of the area of effect.
* Units that negate the stun will still count as passing through the edges. They will become immune to the effects of ''Event Horizon'' for the period even after negating them.
* {{tip|Displacement immune}} enemies will still be {{tip|stun|stunned}}, but not {{tip|knockdown|knocked down}}.
* At the start of the cast time, all enemy {{tip|champions}} in a 390-radius become marked for '''Veigar''' to gain an {{tip|takedown|assist}} on them should they perish within the standard 10 seconds assist time.
* ''Event Horizon'' may fail to catch enemies that move very quickly through the boundary distance.
** More modern area checks such as {{cai|The Box|Thresh}} or {{cai|Yordle Snap Trap|Caitlyn}} do not have this issue.
